title: CBD–VDAC1 binding is crisis-only under ΔΨm collapse
abstract: CBD engagement with VDAC1 (voltage-dependent anion channel) appears conditional on mitochondrial stress (ΔΨm collapse, ROS surge) and high-dose CBD pulse (≥10 μM, 5-15 min). This may explain biphasic therapeutic effects observed in glioblastoma and neuroprotection studies.
if_then_rules: IF ΔΨm↓ AND CBD≥10μM (5-15m pulse) THEN VDAC1 gating↑ (biphasic outcome: rescue or death)
IF CBD<5μM OR no mitochondrial stress THEN VDAC1 gating unchanged
IF pulse >30min THEN toxic accumulation overrides rescue

literature: Oviedo et al. 2008 (bioelectric signaling in regeneration)
evidence.verification: PARTIAL/CONDITIONAL (Perplexity: some support for CBD mitochondrial effects and VDAC1 role in stress, but specific Kd 6-11 μM binding and crisis-dependency need experimental validation)

requested_tests: Mitostress pulse assay (Seahorse XF or JC-1 dye) with CBD dose-response (1, 5, 10, 20 μM)
VDAC1 inhibitor (DIDS, 50-100 μM) ablation under identical pulse conditions
Time-course experiment: 1-min, 5-min, 15-min, 30-min, 60-min CBD pulses to validate temporal window
Calcium imaging (Fluo-4 or GCaMP) to detect VDAC1-mediated Ca²⁺ flux during stress
Western blot for VDAC1 oligomerization state before/after CBD pulse
falsification_tests: If VDAC1 gating increases at CBD <5 μM without mitochondrial stress → claim wrong
If DIDS (VDAC1 inhibitor) has no effect on rescue/death outcome → mechanism wrong
If 1-min pulse equals 15-min pulse outcome (no temporal window) → pulse duration claim wrong
If CBD effects persist equally in VDAC1 knockout cells → VDAC1 not the primary target

ethics.organism: HEK293, U87 glioblastoma, or SH-SY5Y neuroblastoma cells
known_risks: CBD cytotoxicity at high doses (>20 μM)
Mitochondrial stress induction via oligomycin/CCCP (handle with care)
